description: Robotic-assisted laparoscopic vaginal hysterectomy pathology revealed a 4.0 cm FIGO grade II papillary endometrioid adenocarcinoma with >50% myometrial invasion, no cervical involvement, and negative lymph nodes (pT1b pN0).
patient_notes: Your surgery removed the uterus and surrounding tissues, and the pathology showed a type of uterine cancer confined to the uterus with no spread to the lymph nodes. Because the cancer invaded more than half of the muscle layer, your care team may recommend follow-up treatments such as radiation therapy to reduce the risk of recurrence. We will work with you to review and discuss your personalized treatment plan and next steps.

verification.assessment: Staging is accurate. Adjuvant vaginal brachytherapy should be recommended for Stage IB, grade II endometrioid adenocarcinoma per NCCN guidelines.

recommended_treatment.issues: Missing NCCN-recommended adjuvant therapy for Stage IB, grade II endometrioid carcinoma.

change_explanations.recommended_treatment: Changed from 'Not specified' to 'Vaginal brachytherapy'. Reason: Missing NCCN-recommended adjuvant therapy for Stage IB, grade II endometrioid carcinoma.
